2.1.3. Lab – Paths¶

In this section, edit the policy using Visual Policy Editor to enable users to login via AD+MFA, then transition to CertSSO

2.1.3.1. Task – Open Visual Policy Editor¶

  1. On the CERT_SSO profile line click edit under Per-Session Policy

  1. Click the + symbol located on the fallback branch located between the Start and Deny boxes

  1. Select Logon Page under the Logon Tab
  2. Click Add Item

  1. Add an additional field to the logon page by selecting **password ** from the Type dropdown on line 3
  2. Enter OTP for Post Variable Name
  3. Enter OTP for Session Variable Name
  4. Enter OTP for Logon Page Input Field #3

#. Click Save

  1. Click the + symbol located on the fallback branch located between the Logon Page and Deny boxes

  1. Select RADIUS Auth under the Authentication Tab
  2. Click Add Item

  1. Select RADIUS_SERVERS from the AAA Server dropdown box
  2. Change the password source to %{session.logon.last.OTP}
  3. Click Save

  1. Click the + symbol located on the Successful branch located between RADIUS Auth and Deny boxes
  2. Click Add Item

  1. Select AD Auth under the Authentication Tab
  2. Click Add Item

  1. Select f5lab.local from the Server dropdown box
  2. Click Save

  1. Click the + symbol located on the Successful branch located between AD Auth and Deny box
  2. Click Add Item

  1. Select Variable Assign under the Assignment Tab
  2. Click Add Item

  1. Click the Deny ending icon located on the fallback branch of the Variable Assign Agent

  1. Click Allow
  2. Click Save

  1. Apply Access Policy located in the top left corner to commit the policy changes
